page.title: 09FARMING SEASCALE/GOSFORTH
page.content: One Wednesday at 9pm I went out with my dad to calf a cow.We got the calfing bands and a bucket of warm soapy water.The calf was stuck though. Dad said "Go and phone the vet,Craig." The vet came at about 100 m.p.h. from Beckermet.The first thing he asked was could he use the calving aid and would I go and get it? When I got back Dad said "Go and get my razor.We will have to do a caesarean." Caesarean means one side of the cow is cut open to get the calf out.The vet was puffing and panting from pulling the calf.The calf came quite quickly.I kept on holding the power.Dad and Darren took the calf away to the top of the shed to rub it. The vet then got his sewing equipment and sewed up three layers of innards. Dad came from the top of the shed about half an hour later.It was very exciting.
